Hip-HopAlternativeClassic RockMiddle School28184High School22226College162014 What percentage of college students prefer classic rock?

answer.answertext: The data for soccer players are skewed right.

answer.answerhtml: The data for soccer players have less spread than the data for basketball players.

answer.answertext: The data for basketball players have the same median as the data for soccer players.
answer.answerhtml: The data for basketball players have the same median as the data for soccer players.

answer.answertext: The data for basketball players have a greater mean than the data for soccer players.
answer.answerhtml: The data for basketball players have a greater mean than the data for soccer players.

multichoice.questiontext:
A graph of average resting heart rates is shown below. The average resting heart rate for adults is 72 beats per minute, but doctors consider resting rates from 60-100 beats per minute within normal range.
[IMAGE]
Which statement about average resting heart rates is not supported by the graph?
multichoice.questiontexthtml:
A graph of average resting heart rates is shown below. The average resting heart rate for adults is 72 beats per minute, but doctors consider resting rates from 60-100 beats per minute within normal range.

answer.answertext: A 10-year-old has the same average resting heart rate as a 20-year-old.
answer.answerhtml: A 10-year-old has the same average resting heart rate as a 20-year-old.

answer.answertext: A 20-year-old has the same average resting heart rate as a 30-year-old.
answer.answerhtml: A 20-year-old has the same average resting heart rate as a 30-year-old.

answer.answertext: A 40-year-old may have the same average resting heart rate for ten years.
answer.answerhtml: A 40-year-old may have the same average resting heart rate for ten years.

answer.answertext: The average resting heart rate for teenagers steadily decreases.
answer.answerhtml: The average resting heart rate for teenagers steadily decreases.

essay.questiontext: Nora says that the graph of a circle is a function because she can trace the whole graph without picking up her pencil. Mia says that a circle graph is not a function because multiple values of x map to the same y-value. Determine if either one is correct, and justify your answer completely.
essay.questiontexthtml: Nora says that the graph of a circle is a function because she can trace the whole graph without picking up her pencil. Mia says that a circle graph is not a function because multiple values of x map to the same y-value. Determine if either one is correct, and justify your answer completely.

rationale.rationaletext: Neither is correct. Nora's reason is wrong since a circle is not a function because it fails the vertical line test. Mia is wrong since a circle is not a function because multiple values of y map to the same x-value.
rationale.rationalehtml: Neither is correct. Nora's reason is wrong since a circle is not a function because it fails the vertical line test. Mia is wrong since a circle is not a function because multiple values of y map to the same x-value.

essay.questiontext: Two friends went to a restaurant and ordered one plain pizza and two sodas. Their bill totaled $15.95. Later that day, five friends went to the same restaurant. They ordered three plain pizzas and each person had one soda. Their bill totaled $45.90. Write and solve a system of equations to determine the price of one plain pizza. [Only an algebraic solution can receive full credit.]

They ordered three plain pizzas and each person had one soda. Their bill totaled $45.90. Write and solve a system of equations to determine the price of one plain pizza. [Only an algebraic solution can receive full credit.]

essay.questiontext: Ian is borrowing $1000 from his parents to buy a notebook computer. He plans to pay them back at the rate of $60 per month. Ken is borrowing $600 from his parents to purchase a snowboard. He plans to pay his parents back at the rate of $20 per month. Write an equation that can be used to determine after how many months the boys will owe the same amount. Determine algebraically and state in how many months the two boys will owe the same amount. State the amount they will owe at this time. Ian claims that he will have his loan paid off 6 months after he and Ken owe the same amount. Determine and state if Ian is correct. Explain your reasoning.
essay.questiontexthtml: Ian is borrowing $1000 from his parents to buy a notebook computer. He plans to pay them back at the rate of $60 per month. Ken is borrowing $600 from his parents to purchase a snowboard. He plans to pay his parents back at the rate of $20 per month. State the amount they will owe at this time. Ian claims that he will have his loan paid off 6 months after he and Ken owe the same amount. Determine and state if Ian is correct. Explain your reasoning.

rationale.rationaletext: . . . Ian is incorrect because
